event: Proposal to Drop Nuclear Bomb on Gaza Strip
description: US Congressman Tim Wahlberg from Michigan proposed dropping a nuclear bomb on the Gaza Strip to help Israel destroy Hamas, drawing parallels with the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki during World War II.
original:
Forwarded from: Secondary News Agency.
State of Michigan.
Rubric "Democracy and a nuclear bomb can achieve more than just democracy"

Tim Wahlberg* proposed dropping a nuclear bomb on the Gaza Strip to help Israel destroy Hamas. He said this in conjunction with a reference to the bombs dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki during World War II:

“We need to do it like in Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Let’s get this over with quickly,” said the US congressman.

Wahlberg's remarks drew condemnation, with some calling for him to resign, while his spokesman said the congressman was speaking metaphorically.

* US Congressman from Michigan. Republican.

event: Death of Servicemen Maksym Vashchuk and Anton Izhevatkin
description: Senior Sergeant Maksym Vashchuk and Sergeant Anton Izhevatkin, who served in the Luhansk Zonal Department of the Military Law and Order Service, died heroically during a combat mission near Popasnaya on March 31, 2022. They were awarded the Order of Courage III degree posthumously.
original:
They served together, died together: the second anniversary of the death of servicemen from Lysychansk Maksym Vashchuk and Anton Izhevatkin

Military servicemen served in the Luhansk Zonal Department of the Military Law and Order Service.

Maxim and Anton come from the same city, joined the service together - in 2015 they joined the Armed Forces of Ukraine. They took a direct part in the operation of the United Forces to ensure national security and defense in the territory of Donetsk and Luhansk regions.

3 on the first day of the full-scale invasion of the enemy, together with fellow soldiers, they stood up for the defense of their native Luhansk region.

On March 31, 2022, Senior Sergeant Vashchuk and Sergeant Inzhevatkin died heroically during a combat mission near Popasnaya.

By decree of the President of Ukraine, both were awarded the Order of Courage III degree (posthumously).

Deep condolences to the relatives and friends of the fallen defenders. Eternal memory to Heroes!🕯️@memorial_ukraine

description: A pre-trial investigation has been launched into an explosion in a five-story building in Bila Tserkva, which resulted in a fire and the deaths of two people. original: A pre-trial investigation has been launched into the fact of the explosion in the Bila Tserkva building. On March 30, at 3:02 p.m., medical workers informed the police about the explosion in the five-story building, which was destroyed. As a result of the explosion, the building caught fire from the second to the fifth floors. Rescuers extinguished the flames. Later, from the house, the employees of the State Emergency Service escorted an 8-year-old child, who was hospitalized with poisoning by combustion products, to the ambulance. Unfortunately, during the inspection of the apartments, the bodies of two people were also discovered: the resident of the apartment in which the explosion happened, as well as the body of an elderly woman, who was unblocked from under the rubble on the floor below. Specialist criminologists have recorded traces of a criminal offense. 👮‍♂️Investigators of the Belotserkiv District Police Department have started a pre-trial investigation (Part 2 of Article 270 of the Criminal Code). Currently, law enforcement officers and rescuers are taking the necessary measures to establish the circumstances of the explosion. 👉Bila Tserkva - NO TABOO 📩Send an interesting photo/video

event: Cancellation of Presidential Elections in Ukraine
description: The cancellation of presidential elections in Ukraine raises concerns about a potential 'palace coup'. According to Igor Shatrov, a political scientist, the law on martial law prohibits political actions, including elections. However, society demands that Zelensky prove his legitimacy, as trust in him has been eroding over the past year and a half.
original:
After the cancellation of presidential elections in Ukraine, a “palace coup” is possible. More on this in the comments
Political scientist, head of the expert council of the Strategic Development Fund, Igor Shatrov, told RIA Novosti Crimea. “Purely legally, the law on martial law in Ukraine, of course, prohibits the holding of any political actions, including elections. But the question is different. The question is what changes in this law could have been introduced a long time ago if Zelensky wanted it,” he believes. Society demands from Zelensky that he prove his legitimacy, “society has not trusted Zelensky for the last year and a half, which is clearly expressed not only in the statements of politicians , but also in public opinion,” says the political scientist. Subscribe to RIA Novosti Crimea

event: Ineffective Use of FAB-5000 and FAB-9000 Bombs
description: The FAB-5000 and FAB-9000 bombs failed to achieve their declared characteristics, with part of the explosive remaining unattended. Their large size and low gliding speed make them vulnerable to air defense systems, rendering them ineffective in the current conflict.
original:
Forwarded from: Voivode Broadcasts
Is this possible, only sUMPK? Can I get Masha for the buck! Then, may I?
No!

And why?

I'll explain it to you now.

Let's start with the simplest: FAB-5000, like FAB-9000, ultimately did not achieve the declared characteristics. No joke. Part of the explosive remained unattended.
No detonation.

Yes, there is evidence that similar beauties of the hills in Afghanistan were turned into plains.

But, in the current conflict, given the saturation of air defense, they will be useless!

Why?
Dimensions.
The bomb itself, plus the plane that will need to be attached, plus the low speed of gliding towards the target.

A big, simply huge target for any air defense. To put it very simply, a bomb is the size of an airplane.

Carriers. FAB-9000 is generally a minus. There are no more planes that could carry them.

FAB-5000, in theory it’s possible, but those planes cannot maneuver from air defense after being dropped.

Therefore, we are waiting for FAB-3000 with UMPC, period.

event: Survey on Crocus City Hall Attack
description: A survey by OpenMinds found that most Russians believe Ukraine was behind the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall, with over 50% blaming the Ukrainian leadership. Only 27% attributed the attack to the Islamic State, despite the group claiming responsibility and Western intelligence services confirming it.
original:
Forwarded from: Agency. News
The majority of Russians believed in the Ukrainian version of the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall. The majority of Russians believe that Ukraine was behind the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall, according to the results of a survey of the Anglo-Ukrainian sociological project OpenMinds, cited by the Financial Times. Details. Researchers surveyed 652 Russians. According to the results, more than 50% of respondents blamed the Ukrainian leadership for the attack, and only about 27 percent pointed to the Islamic State (IS). Another 6% blamed the “collective West,” namely the US, UK and NATO.▪️Several percent each believe that veterans of the war in Ukraine and the Russian authorities were behind the attack.▪️The most reliable or completely reliable source of information about the attack is more than 75% The respondents named Vladimir Putin, who after the terrorist attack spoke several times about the role of Ukraine in the attack on the concert hall.▪️Young people and opponents of the war in Ukraine do not believe in the Ukrainian version, which is being promoted by the authorities. Among opponents of the war, 50% believe that IS was behind the terrorist attack. More than 40% of Russians aged 18 to 30 believe that the attack was organized by this group. The Ukrainian version is supported by just over 30%.▪️Experts have repeatedly pointed out the difficulty of assessing the sincerity of Russians when conducting opinion polls, since people may be afraid to express their real position due to the suppression of dissent in the country. The FT makes a similar reservation when publishing the survey results.▪️OpenMinds previously surveyed Russians about their attitude towards the death of Alexei Navalny, reaction to the death of Yevgeny Prigozhin and perception of the war between Israel and Hamas. Context. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack. This was confirmed by Western intelligence services.▪️In his first address after the terrorist attack, Putin spoke only about the Ukrainian trace. Later, during a meeting on measures taken after the attack, Putin confirmed that the attack was carried out “at the hands of radical Islamists,” but said that it was beneficial to the “neo-Nazi Kyiv regime.” Subscribe to the Agency

event: Romania to Issue Schengen Visas to Russians
description: Romania will begin issuing Schengen visas to Russian citizens from March 31, allowing them to enter the Schengen zone for up to 90 days during any 180-day period. Applications can be submitted at Romanian consulates in Moscow, St. Petersburg, and Rostov-on-Don.
original:
Romania will begin issuing Schengen visas to Russians from March 31, Romanian embassy officials said. Applications can be submitted at all country consulates in Russia - in Moscow, St. Petersburg and Rostov-on-Don. Unified visas issued after March 31 will allow Russian citizens enter the Schengen zone for up to 90 days during any 180-day period, the embassy noted.

They also recalled that visas issued until March 31, 2024 can be used for the entire duration of their validity only for entry into Romania, also on the basis of the provisions set out in EU Decision No. 565/2014.

If holders of short-term visas issued before March 31 are planning to visit one of the Schengen countries, they need to apply for a visa to the country of final destination.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Tajik poet Muhammad Azizov expressed hatred towards the Russian people in a poem, calling them 'dogs' and 'yellowheads'. Forwarded from: Multinational
Tajik poet Muhammad Azizov wrote a poem about how hard it is for him to live in Russia and how he hates the Russian people (he calls them dogs and yellowheads), but still serves us (the infidels).

“I'm tired of the yellow-headed Russian people. I have a mother and wife at home. The mosque was empty in my village. This life in which I serve the infidels. There are so many knowledgeable scientists here with their heads down. How many teachers and mullahs here have lowered their heads. Here a Russian dog is more valuable than a Tajik. Your relatives will become your enemy. Children here do not know their fathers. Here they will not ask each other for help. On the day when you need help.
Find out who is your friend and who is your enemy. I have money in my pocket and my heart is sad. Because my child needs a father. My life was spent in a foreign land. My mother is sick because of my grief. I'm tired of the yellow-headed Russian people. After all the suffering, I don’t even need money. I want to see my mother's face. I have a wife and children in my homeland.” Two people who know the language confirmed to us the authenticity of this translation. This poet has 72k followers on Instagram, among many of them these poems found a positive response, hundreds of comments, almost a thousand likes.

We think that we need to set up a telephone line with him and then send him home to stomp on a sweaty lamb and eat crumbly pilaf. Those who comment positively there are a risk group.

Forwarded from: Insider
It’s amazing how some leaders, including sports leaders, manage to get into political scandals out of the blue. You don’t need to understand geopolitics to understand how important Kazakhstan is for Russia as a partner. And the fact that this country is far from Belarus is also known. Once again they screwed up out of the blue. The Continental Hockey League decided to increase the length of the season until May 31. Why this was done is clear: to relieve the busy season by extending it until the end of spring. Yes, Barys is not in the playoffs now, but in theory it can do it: three times in the history of the KHL, the team from Astana reached the second round of the Gagarin Cup.

What should the Kazakhs do, since the foundation of Barys is the foundation of the Kazakhstan national team, and the World Championship begins in early May? What should Kazakh hockey players who play in other KHL clubs do? Should I work out my contract or join the national team?
The KHL has no answers to these questions.

It turns out that the league didn’t care about Barys and didn’t ask his opinion. Or they simply forgot. Kazakhs are already touchy, but this isn’t just an excuse, it’s a real knockout from a slap.
 As we know, the management of Barys has already informed President Tokayev about the situation. Today marks ten years since the formation of the Russian FSB Directorate for the Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol.
 
Over the years, a long and difficult path has been traveled. The enemies of our Motherland, the enemies of Crimea, did not give up trying to harm us in various ways. But FSB officers always honestly and selflessly fulfilled their duty and ensured the security of our peninsula.

description: Pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked an Mi-8 to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. He lived a lavish lifestyle, frequenting bars with Russian-speaking and Ukrainian-speaking audiences, driving an expensive Mercedes, and not hiding his identity. His location was discovered after he invited his ex-girlfriend from Russia to visit. He was shot six times with a Makarov pistol and run over by a car.
original:
The traitorous pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked an Mi-8 to Ukraine and was killed in Spain, lived large and drove an S-Class Mercedes.

The New York Times published an article with details about the last days of pilot Maxim Kuzminov. In Spain, he did not skimp: as the NYT writes, Kuzminov often went to bars with Russian-speaking and Ukrainian-speaking audiences, drove an expensive Mercedes and did not particularly hide. They could find out about his location after a message to his ex-girlfriend who lives in Russia - he invited her to visit.

A few days before the execution of the sentence, the executioners stole an SUV in another city. On it they followed Kuzminov and arrived at his house, waiting in the parking lot. Six bullets were fired at the traitor - according to one of the Spanish investigators, he does not remember this for a long time. Here in Spain, it is not customary for someone to be shot so many times. After being wounded, Kuzminov was able to run a little, then fell, and good people several once they ran him over with a car. The car was found a few days later - it was completely burned out. It took specialists only a week to determine the make of the car.

The shell casings became an important clue for the Spanish police: Kuzminov was shot with a Makarov pistol. According to Spanish investigators, this can be considered a definite message :)

event: Initiative for Bureau of Missing Civilians and Family Reunification
description: The Nevsky Brigade of the Russian Defense Ministry's Volunteer Corps proposed an initiative to establish a 'Bureau for the Search of Missing Civilians and Family Reunification' after the expected victory. This bureau would help locate missing relatives and provide family documents found in ruins. The idea is inspired by a similar bureau operating in Germany after World War II.
original:
THE VOLUNTEER CORPS OF THE RUSSIAN DEFENSE MINISTRY (NEVSKY BRIGADE) HAVE EXPRESSED AN INTERESTING INITIATIVE

We must already assume today that after our victory there will be a need to create a “Bureau for the Search of Missing Civilians and Family Reunification.” A similar bureau, after our victory in the Great Patriotic War, still operates in Germany. And we worked in this bureau, filming everything in detail.

How many people have died after the aggression of Ukrainian nationalists against the Russian people since 2013? Then the blockade of Donbass. It happened, I’m not making this up. And then Ukraine was completely closed, like a tin can. Now even Ukrainians with dual citizenship are unable to leave it.

So, the Nevsky brigade of the Volunteer Corps of our Ministry of Defense is taking care of the unmarked graves in Soledar. Saves, if found in ruins, family documents of civilians, so that later he can give them to people - this will help find missing relatives.

This is where an interesting idea was born: even before the victory, prepare such a bureau to help people. And the brigade is fighting, it now has a lot of combat worries. But the initiative belongs to her and the Corps.

Details today in “News of the Week” at 20:00 on “Russia-1”.

Forwarded from: Türkiye 2.0

The leader of the leading opposition Republican People's Party (RPP), Özgür Özel, stated this on Sunday, commenting on the incoming results of local elections in the republic, according to which the RPP wins in most regions of the country. “I thank the Republican People's Party. The election results showed that voters decided to establish a new political system in Turkey. description: Snipers of the Nevsky brigade demonstrated exceptional marksmanship skills, successfully hitting a moving target at a range of 1170 meters using the TSVL-8 M5 'Dominator' .338LM rifle. original:
The snipers of the Nevsky* brigade worked "on the engine", at a range of 1170 meters, from the TSVL-8 M5 "Dominator" .338LM rifle.

Usually they don’t work for a kilo on a moving target. In American manuals, work on the “engine” is limited for the US Army - 500 meters, for the Marine Corps - 600 yards. Because the complexity of such a shot is prohibitive. In addition to taking into account derivation and wind, it is also necessary to take into account the movement. And to do this, you need to understand the speed of the target, and it is also advisable to take into account its course. Brrr!...

But we CAN! That's why we work!

*All snipers of the Nevsky brigade are trained at the Lobaev sniper school, on the basis of the brigade’s training center.

The Belgorod operational headquarters has restricted entry into the territory of the Grayvoronsky urban district - women and children are not allowed there. Residents write comments on the governor’s latest post: many are surprised and unhappy with this decision.

According to the Operational Headquarters, from March 20, in order to ensure the safety of residents in the territory of the city of Grayvoron, Kozinsky rural settlement, Gora-Podol, Glotovo, Novostroevka-Pervaya, Novostroevka-Vtoraya and Bezymeno, entry is limited, posts with employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Russian National Guard, and the border service of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation have been established and the district administration. “REMEMBER! “- this inscription on Makarov’s poster hung on the wall of his office.

On March 31, 1904, while defending Port Arthur, the commander of the Pacific Fleet, Vice Admiral Stepan Osipovich Makarov, died while on board the flagship battleship Petropavlovsk, which exploded on a Japanese mine.
The sailors, with their trusty instincts, immediately appreciated the significance of this loss: “What Petropavlovsk”... Makarov died - his head was gone.”

The tragic death of Vice Admiral Makarov was a heavy loss for the fleet and the country. He was at the peak of his strength and talent and could continue his fruitful work as an excellent sailor, skilled naval commander and talented scientist-innovator for many years to come.
Makarov left an instructive legacy to the fleet in the form of scientific works and vast practical experience. It went to worthy successors - the sailors of the glorious Soviet Navy, who in the life of Admiral Makarov see an example of ardent love for the rigors of naval service, tireless improvement, selfless service to the Motherland and loyalty to the best traditions of our fleet.

description: Russia has made significant progress in repaying its external debt since 2022, reducing it from 488 billion to 317 billion. The country has also decreased its foreign currency debt from 353 billion to 208 billion, achieving a 2.5 times reduction in 10 years. This rapid debt repayment has occurred without impacting financial stability, weakening pressure on the ruble and decreasing dependence on external creditors.
original:
Forwarded from: Spydell_finance
Russia has managed to almost completely repay its external debt since the beginning of 2022. While all the leading countries of the world are accumulating debts, Russia manages to pay them off without a significant impact on financial stability. At the beginning of 2022, the external debt amounted to 488 billion with the maximum volume for all time being 733 billion (2Q14 before the introduction of Crimean sanctions), and two years later - 317 billion. However, debt in foreign currency is important, because

• Firstly, due to restrictions on foreign exchange funding, the shortage of foreign currency in the domestic market has a negative impact on the ruble exchange rate.

The accumulation of foreign exchange positions to repay external debt was one of the reasons for the collapse of the ruble in mid-2023 against the background of the depletion of the current account surplus.

• Secondly, ruble-denominated external debt is more than successfully balanced by internal cash flows or, if necessary, regulatory easing.

The one who directly issues debt always has operational freedom in managing the debt position, which cannot be said about debt in foreign currency, placed, as a rule, in a foreign jurisdiction. There has been significant progress with foreign currency debt: at the beginning of 2022 it was 353 billion, but became 208 billion, and the all-time maximum was in 1Q14 at the level of 549 billion, i.e. reduction by 1.7 times in two years and 2.5 times in 10 years. In world history, there has been no precedent for such a large-scale and rapid reduction in external debt in conditions of a stable macroeconomic background (the economy by April 2024 is approximately 2% higher than December 2021).

Foreign currency external debt of the non-financial private sector is even less – 155 billion vs 244 billion at the beginning of 2022.

Speaking about the almost complete repayment of external debt, it is necessary to compare with the current account surplus for the year, which is approximately half of the open debt position. The pressure on the ruble is strategically weakening, even on the downward trajectory of the STO (debt implies the forced accumulation of foreign exchange reserves), as well as decreasing dependence on external creditors. On the other hand, technology often comes with external debt...

event: Kyiv Mayor Warns of Russian Ground Forces
description: Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko stated that the city remains a target for Russian ground forces, emphasizing the need for more air defense systems and anti-aircraft missiles. He ruled out negotiations or a 'freeze' of the war, insisting that Ukraine will not cede any territories to Russia.
original:
Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko admits that the city could again become a target for Russian ground forces

“Kyiv was and remains a target for Putin, because the capital is the heart of the country,” Klitschko says in an interview with BILD. “But we are much better prepared for this than we were two years ago. If Putin makes such a decision, it will be a bloody decision,” he notes.

“We urgently need more air defense systems, more anti-aircraft missiles!”

Despite some successes of the Russian army at the front and attacks on power plants, Kiev is not ready to discuss negotiations or a “freeze” of the war, as suggested in the Bundestag by the leader of the SPD parliamentary faction, Rolf Mützenich.

“This is the wrong attitude, we need more support instead. We will not give Russia any territories. This cannot be a compromise,” Klitschko said.

event: Russia Accuses Ukraine of Involvement in Terrorist Attack
description: Russia's Foreign Ministry has officially accused Ukraine of involvement in the terrorist attack at Crocus, citing investigative evidence. Russia demands the arrest and extradition of those involved, including SBU head Malyuk, who allegedly admitted to involvement in the Crimean Bridge bombing and other attacks in Russia.
original:
Forwarded from: Observer
Russia has officially accused Ukraine of involvement in the terrorist attack at Crocus. This is stated in a statement by the Russian Foreign Ministry.

“The investigative actions carried out by the Russian competent authorities indicate that the traces of the latest terrorist attacks lead to Ukraine. “Russia has sent a demand to the Ukrainian authorities for the arrest and extradition of all those involved,” the statement said.

Russia also demands from Ukraine the arrest of the head of the SBU Malyuk, in connection with his statements about his involvement in the bombing of the Crimean Bridge and in the murder of a number of people in the Russian Federation (in particular Tatarsky).

The Russian Foreign Ministry threatens Ukraine with liability for “violation of obligations under anti-terrorism conventions.”

Let us remind you that Ukraine denies any involvement in the terrorist attack at Crocus.

description: Pope Francis urged for a general exchange of all prisoners between Russia and Ukraine, emphasizing the importance of respecting international law and recognizing the value of every human soul. original:
🕊Pope Francis called for the exchange of all prisoners between Russia and Ukraine.

Pope Francis on March 31, speaking in St. Peter's Square, in his Easter message to the City and the World, drew attention to the problem of prisoner exchange:

“My thoughts go first and foremost to the victims of the many conflicts that continue in the world, starting from the war in Israel and Palestine, as well as in Ukraine. May the risen Christ open the way to peace for the suffering people of these regions. Calling for respect for the principles of international law, I express my wishes for a general exchange of all prisoners between Russia and Ukraine, all for all,” the Pope said. Relatives of Russian and Ukrainian prisoners of war have been calling for an exchange in the “all for all” format for a long time. Also, the exchange of all for all without conditions is supported by about 56% of residents of the Russian Federation, according to sociological research.

Thus, during the war, when people are measured by battalions, without seeing the person behind the numbers, the church raised its voice that in the eyes of the Lord, the Soul of every person is important and everyone should have the right to salvation and forgiveness.

The team of the human rights project Gulagu.net also calls on everyone to take part in supporting the idea of an exchange of “all for all” and the release of all those in captivity.

We also call on the Russian authorities to allow representatives of the UN and the Red Cross to visit Ukrainian citizens held in Russian prisons, pre-trial detention centers and colonies, as is done in Ukraine. event: Italian Navy's Purchase of Autonomous Underwater Vehicles
description: The Italian Navy has submitted a program to the Italian Parliament for the purchase of three large autonomous uninhabited underwater vehicles, BlueWhale, developed by Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI). The devices will be equipped with Italian-made equipment and are planned for reconnaissance use. The estimated cost of the 13-year program is 254.3 million euros.
original:
Forwarded from: bmpd
It is reported that the Italian Navy has submitted for approval to the Italian Parliament a program for the purchase of three large autonomous uninhabited underwater vehicles BlueWhale developed by the Israeli company Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI). In accordance with the Italian-Israeli memorandums 2021 and 2022. about Italy's participation in the development of BlueWhale, the devices will be equipped with equipment from Italian companies Elettronica, FAAM, CABI Cattaneo, BATS Italia and ICS Technologies. The estimated cost of the program for the purchase, testing and operation of NPA, designed for 13 years, is 254.3 million euros. The devices are planned to be used mainly for reconnaissance. BlueWhale has a length of 10.9 m, a diameter of more than 1.1 m and a weight of 5.5 tons. The power plant is electric with lithium-ion batteries from FAAM, autonomy is claimed to be up to 30 days. Control via satellite channel through a retractable mast. Operating speed is 2-3 knots, maximum speed is up to 7 knots. Photo (c) IAI

original:

Before his eyes, his partner was shot at point-blank range, and then Alexey and other concert hall workers led people behind them and hid them in technical rooms, defending the door with an ax against terrorists with machine guns. He, together with his colleagues and rescuers, managed to bring out 97% of the spectators alive. Alexey says that every employee worked exactly according to instructions, and the guards fought for the people to the last. Now many of them are in hospitals, and some have died.
I just want to say thank you to this man and the rest of the Crocus team.

description: Ukraine launched a recruiting project in November 2023 to attract qualified specialists for military specialties similar to civilian ones, such as signalmen, IT specialists, and cooks. The process involves reviewing vacancies, interviews, testing, and military training. However, issues arise at the TCC level, with people being sent to wrong units, neglect of civilian professions, and cronyism.
original:
✏️Ukrainian media writes about the problems of a soft alternative to mobilization.

This is called "Recruiting". Its essence is to attract qualified specialists to the Armed Forces of Ukraine for military specialties similar to civilian ones: signalmen, IT specialists, cooks, etc. You can choose a department of your choice.📝The project was launched in November 2023. During this time, more than 8,500 vacancies appeared on job search sites. The recruiting process is similar to the civilian one: a review for a vacancy, an interview, testing, a letter of recommendation for the TCC medical board, military training and the start of work.

Everything “breaks down” at the TCC level and beyond: people are sent to the wrong units to which they wanted, they don’t look at civilian professions, a lot is tied to cronyism and the personal desires of the TCC.🧐Against the background of problems with mobilization, the question remains open how many cooks and engineers will end up in the assault battalions .Irina Kuksenkova

description: On March 31, 1814, Russian troops led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered Paris, marking the end of the Napoleonic wars. Alexander I ensured the city's protection, released prisoners, banned looting, and provided for the poor and needy citizens.
original:
Forwarded from: ⚔️🛡Last Russian
​​⚔️On March 31, 1814, Russian troops led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered Paris. After the defeat on the Berezina in December 1812, the remnants of the French army fled from Russian territory. But in order to finally remove the military threat, Alexander I led troops to France.
 
Paris was taken under the personal protection of Alexander I. The prisoners were released, a strict ban on looting was introduced, and the poor and needy citizens were provided with food.

Moreover, the Russian emperor forbade the destruction of the column with the statue of Napoleon.
 
The capture of Paris marked the end of a series of Napoleonic wars that shook the Old World. Russia has declared itself as the leading military-political force on the continent. The end of the Napoleonic era, achieved by the heroism of the Russian army, became the basis for many years of peaceful development of Russia and Europe.

description: Polish meteorologist Katarzyna Kudlacz had an unexpected encounter with a polar bear and its two cubs at a research station in Hornsund, Spitsbergen. The bears approached the apartment building, looking into windows and scratching on them. Kudlacz alerted her colleagues, who successfully drove the bears away using a flare gun.
original:
“I’ll knock on your window...” Polish meteorologist Katarzyna Kudlacz works at a research station in Hornsund in the south of Spitsbergen. On Wednesday morning last week, her colleagues went to work, and she stayed behind to look after the apartment building. It is unlikely that she was expecting guests - but they appeared while she was preparing breakfast.

The uninvited guests turned out to be a polar bear with two cubs. They looked into the windows, scratched and knocked on them with their paws.

Such a visit could have dire consequences, so Kudlach immediately reported the uninvited guests to her colleagues. They immediately decided to come to the rescue. They managed to drive away the bears with the help of a flare gun. According to the head of the station, Daniel Kempsky, polar bears are a common sight in these parts, and they are becoming more and more common. Over the course of 9 months, he and his colleagues observed these animals 40 times. Fortunately, , they are simply curious rather than aggressive, and leave after the first warning shot in the air. It was great to see them so close, but it was better to see them from a distance.

description: Andrey Koshkin, a political analyst, believes the US controls Ukraine's political processes. He argues that Ukraine's democratic status is questionable, given the lack of elections under martial law. Zelensky's reluctance to hold elections stems from fear of losing power. Koshkin notes a shift in Zelensky's rhetoric, reflecting a change in US strategy, which may indicate a willingness to negotiate.
original: The head of the department of political analysis and socio-psychological processes of the Plekhanov Russian University of Economics, Andrey Koshkin, believes that all political processes in Ukraine are controlled by the United States, therefore, the question of canceling the presidential elections should not be asked to Zelensky: the United States constantly emphasizes that Ukraine is a democratic state. And when asked why elections are not held then, they answer that there is martial law there. Well, then cancel the provision or admit that this is an authoritarian state, and Zelensky is an appointed dictator, acting as president as long as Washington needs it. As for Zelensky himself, he is not interested in holding elections, the loss of which would be fatal for him. He would like to imagine his future more clearly - will they let him go or should he continue to fight, destroying Ukraine and Ukrainian society. The political scientist also noted Zelensky’s changed rhetoric, reflecting a change in concept among his American curators: Zelensky suddenly started saying that he no longer demands from Russia to remove troops to the borders of 1991, he already agrees to the position of 2022. This demonstrates some understanding in Washington, where decisions are being made that Ukraine may not make it until November 2024. This means it’s time to work out the option that is being talked about everywhere in the world - it’s time to sit down at the negotiating table. After all, it may turn out that their trump cards will depreciate more and more over time.📮Subscribe to BREAKING

description: The School for Young Humanitarians, 'Russia is my Future', is accepting applications for its third iteration. The 7-day program, held from April 22 to 28, 2024, at the Sretensky Theological Academy, offers a comprehensive educational program, practical courses, and an excursion program. Participants will engage with experts in the humanities and public opinion leaders, and receive a certificate and gifts upon completion.
original:
Forwarded from: “Russia is my future” School for young humanists
ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS FOR THE THIRD SCHOOL FOR YOUNG HUMANITIES “RUSSIA IS MY FUTURE” CONTINUES

Dear friends!

We invite students of humanities majors at Moscow universities - bachelors, masters, and graduate students - to take part in the project. The school will be held from April 22 to April 28, 2024 at the Sretensky Theological Academy. Classes will be held face-to-face throughout the day for 7 days. Participation in the project is completely free.

A special educational program has been developed for participants. Knowledge about the history of Russia, about Orthodoxy, about Russian culture and literature, about values, traditions and worldviews, about what shaped our identity - all this will help to better understand the past of our country in order to boldly look into the future.

In addition to the main curriculum, project participants will undergo training in two practical courses: “Fundamentals of Copywriting” and “Methodology and Tools of Information Warfare.” An exciting excursion program is also planned for School participants.

The project's teaching staff are recognized experts in the humanities and public opinion leaders.

Upon completion of the School, each participant will receive a Certificate and memorable gifts. But the most important thing is that during the project you will meet interesting people, meet like-minded people and friends, and join the alumni community to participate in other educational initiatives and projects.

The competition for participation in the School will be held until April 7, 2024 (inclusive).

You can find out more about the project and the competition by following the link to the School’s page on the Sretensky Theological Academy website: https://sdamp.ru/life/school-young-humanitarians/.
Also subscribe to the project pages on social networks - VK and Telegram: t.me/russia_my_future - to follow its development. Also here you will learn about how the first and second School for Young Humanities took place in October 2023 and February 2024. The project is being implemented using a grant from the President of the Russian Federation provided by the Presidential Grants Foundation.

event: Russia Accuses Ukraine of Involvement in Crocus Terrorist Attack
description: Russia's Foreign Ministry has officially accused Ukraine of involvement in the terrorist attack at Crocus, citing testimony from suspects. However, the credibility of this testimony is questionable due to documented human rights abuses by Russian security forces.
original:
What are the consequences of Russia's accusations against Ukraine of involvement in the Crocus terrorist attack?

The statement by the Russian Foreign Ministry officially accusing Ukraine of involvement in the terrorist attack at Crocus and not only raises the question - what next?

It is absolutely clear that Ukraine will not comply with Moscow’s demands and will not arrest the head of the SBU Malyuk. Ukraine completely denies accusations of involvement in the terrorist attack.

What will Russia do in response?

In fact, the Russian Federation is already waging a full-scale war against Ukraine, using all possible types of weapons except nuclear ones.

Will Russia use nuclear weapons? There could be an extremely negative international reaction. Including from countries friendly to the Russian Federation. Like, for example, China, which has repeatedly stated that it is against the use of nuclear weapons.

Will the Russian Federation try to kill Zelensky, Malyuk, Budanov? As for the last two, they were already a possible target for Russian strikes. At least last year, Russian media actively wrote that Budanov was allegedly killed or wounded during attacks on Kyiv. So here the question is not only of desire, but also of possibility. Although it cannot be ruled out that it is in this form that the Russians will try to carry out “retribution.”

Declaring Ukrainian government agencies and intelligence services as “terrorist organizations” and Ukraine as a “terrorist state”? There are virtually no relations between Russia and Ukraine anyway. Therefore, assigning “terrorist” status will not fundamentally change anything in practice.

And, in general, any tough actions on the part of the Russian Federation against Ukraine as a “response” to the terrorist attack in Crocus are unlikely to receive at least some understanding or, especially, support from not only the West, but also the largest countries of the “global south” " Because no objective evidence of Ukraine’s involvement in the terrorist attack has been presented at the moment.

All accusations against Kyiv, judging by the statements of the Russian investigative authorities, are based on the testimony of suspects in the terrorist attack. However, after the Russian security forces themselves documented and distributed through telegram channels photos and videos of beatings, cutting off ears and electrocuting suspects, the credibility of their testimony is zero even in the eyes of countries loyal to the Russian Federation and foreign politicians.

Then what is the purpose of the statement by the Russian Foreign Ministry?

It can be assumed that its main addressee is not Kyiv, but the West.

Russia has long been sending hints to the West that expanding support for Ukraine, including the supply of a number of types of weapons, could lead to a direct military clash between the Russian Federation and NATO with the prospect of a transition to nuclear war. This is something that the West does not want to allow (at least the leaders of the largest countries).

And the statement accusing Ukraine of a terrorist attack once again demonstrates Russia’s readiness to take the war to a different level in order to block the expansion of Western assistance. At least from wavering countries like Germany.

Although whether this will work is an open question.

Also, naturally, promoting the version of Ukraine’s involvement also has internal Russian goals - strengthening the public’s readiness to continue the war and increasing the level of its support. description: Starting April 1st, smoking marijuana will be officially allowed in public places in Germany, including Oktoberfest, as long as it's not within 100 meters of schools, kindergartens, and playgrounds. The festival, which attracts around 7 million guests, may see a shift from beer to cannabis consumption.
original:
“Oktoberfest will now become narcotic?”: Starting tomorrow in Germany, it will be allowed to smoke marijuana “100 meters from schools and kindergartens” - the Germans are sure that no one will need beer at Oktoberfest anymore.

“According to the mayor of Munich, Dominik Krause, the Oktoberfest festival, during which about 7 million guests drink just under a liter of beer per person, is already “the world’s largest open drug scene.” Another drug could be making its legal appearance at Oktoberfest this year. It looks like we're about to have a marijuana festival, as smoking cannabis in public places will be officially allowed from April 1st.
The new law prohibits smoking cannabis within 100 meters of schools, kindergartens and playgrounds, but the beer festival is taking place on the Theresienwiese meadow, a huge vacant lot in the center of Munich. Even if festival guests are prohibited from smoking in the tents themselves, many will be able to do so on the balconies of the tents and in the beer gardens. Oktoberfest director Clemens Baumgaertner promised that organizers would “carefully study the law”, but they already have a “bad feeling”.
It is noted that according to the law on cannabis, residents of Germany are prohibited from smoking marijuana in the “close proximity” of children. However, how the term “immediate proximity” is defined is still unclear.”

event: Flight Testing of Il-114-300 Passenger Aircraft
description: The United Aircraft Corporation resumed flight testing of the Il-114-300 passenger aircraft, with the second prototype taking off. The 40-minute flight tested the aircraft's stability, controllability, and on-board systems, reaching a height of 900 meters and a speed of 230 km/h.
location: Luchansk Aircraft Repair Plant named after P.A. Voronin, Luhansk, Ukraine
original:
The United Aircraft Corporation resumed the flight testing program of the new Il-14-300 passenger aircraft, and the second prototype of the aircraft took off. This was reported by the UAC press service.

On March 31, 2024, the second prototype of the Il-114-300 aircraft, assembled at LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin. The flight lasted 40 minutes, the plane rose to a height of 900 meters and picked up a speed of 230 km/h. The stability and controllability of the aircraft was checked, as well as the stable operation of on-board systems and equipment. The flight was normal. The plane was piloted by a crew consisting of the aircraft commander, chief pilot, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Sergei Sukhar, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Igor Zinov, and on-board test engineer 1st class Oleg Gryazev, the report says.

description: The Brazilian shipyard Itaguai Construçoes Navais (ICN) launched the third large diesel-electric submarine, S 42 Tonelero, for the Brazilian Navy. The submarine is part of the French Scorpene project and is expected to begin sea trials soon, with full deployment planned for next year.
original:
On March 27, the Brazilian shipyard Itaguai Construçoes Navais (ICN) near Rio de Janeiro launched the third large diesel-electric submarine under construction for the Brazilian Navy, the S 42 Tonelero - the third in the local series of the French Scorpene project. The ceremony was held in the presence of the presidents of Brazil and France. Sea trials of the submarine are expected to begin in the coming months, and its full deployment to service in the Brazilian Navy is planned for next year. The last, fourth, submarine of the series will be launched in 2025.

The construction of four submarines for the Brazilian fleet is carried out in accordance with an agreement concluded in September 2009 with the French shipbuilding association DCNS (now Naval Group), at the ICN shipyard created as part of the joint venture. Thanks to him, the Brazilian Navy was able to significantly strengthen the combat capabilities of the underwater component, and local shipbuilding to raise its level by mastering a number of French technologies during the project.

Brazil is another example of a country that, by putting foreign models into service, organizes the maximum possible localization of their production, technology transfer and other maximum possible “import substitution” in order to strengthen national military-industrial and military-technological potential.#LatinAmerica#BrazilMilitary Informant

description: A domestic gas explosion occurred in an apartment building in Bila Tserkva, caused by violations of fire safety rules. The blast resulted in the collapse of concrete floors between the second and third floors, killing two people, including a 49-year-old man and a pensioner. An eight-year-old girl was hospitalized for smoke poisoning.
original:
In Bila Tserkva yesterday, a domestic gas explosion occurred in an apartment building.

Strana learned about this from sources in law enforcement agencies.

“It was established that the explosion occurred on the third floor in apartment 32 due to violations of fire safety rules. Due to the explosion, concrete floors collapsed in apartments 32 and 28 between the second and third floors.

The dead were found in apartment 32, where the explosion occurred, a man died there, he was 49 years old, he rented the apartment. A pensioner in apartment 28 also died.

One eight-year-old girl was hospitalized for smoke poisoning,” says the source.

He also added that a criminal case has been opened on this fact under Article 270 - violation of fire safety requirements. description: Skilled repairmen at a repair hangar are working to restore damaged equipment, including tanks, to service. They are developing a system to protect against enemy drones and have started receiving anti-drone devices for installation on their equipment.
original:
Protecting equipment from enemy drones
The repair hangar is in full swing - equipment that was “wounded” in battles is returned to service by skilled repairmen.
“It was a blast. Here the side was turned out, the “gooska” (caterpillar) was damaged -
Show more
A repair company specialist talks about the damage to the tank. “We cut off the completely torn part and are now restoring the side. The guska has already been replaced. Now we’ll make the blanks, weld them on, and hang the protection. Everything is as it should be."
“There was a case when a tank, after a powerful explosion with serious damage, arrived for repairs under its own power. It smokes, but it goes. What a miracle! And the entire crew returned intact, and also completed a combat mission,” the experienced soldier recalled an incident from front-line life.
“Our technology is good, it just needs improvement,” he continued. With the advent of drones, a system of protection against them is being developed. We are already receiving deliveries of anti-drone devices that we are installing on our equipment,” says the military repairman.
#BehindUsTruth #WeDon’t Abandon Our Own

event: Use of ODAB-1500 Heavy Aerial Bomb
description: The Russian Federation employed the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb in Ukraine for the first time, targeting positions in Velikaya Pisarevka, Sumy region. The bomb's operating principle involves a two-stage explosion, first dispersing a flammable aerosol and then igniting it, resulting in a supersonic shock wave and high temperatures that cause significant damage to the target.
original:
The Russian Federation used the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb in Ukraine for the first time - Bild
The projectile was launched at positions in Velikaya Pisarevka, Sumy region. After the impact of the Volumetric Detonating Air Bomb, a kilometer-high cloud of smoke rose in the sky.
Show more
The operating principle of ODAB is based on the detonation of a cloud of flammable aerosol. The explosion occurs in two stages: first, a small charge of a conventional explosive is detonated, the task of which is to evenly distribute the flammable substance throughout the volume of the cloud. The resulting aerosol cloud is then ignited using a detonator. As a result, a supersonic shock wave and high temperatures are formed at the bomb release site, which cause the main damage to the attacked target.
Rosich | Rosich

description: A tourist base in the Apsheronsky district of the Krasnodar Territory caught fire, forcing vacationers to flee in swimsuits and swimming trunks. The rapid spread of the fire was likely caused by a gas-air mixture, with sounds of gas cylinder explosions heard in the footage. One person was hospitalized with a fracture, and the number of victims may increase.
original:
A tourist base caught fire in the Krasnodar Territory - people had to flee from the fire almost naked to the sounds of gas cylinder explosions. The fire took vacationers of a tourist base in the Apsheronsky district of the Krasnodar Territory by surprise. They had to flee from the fire, which quickly engulfed the building, in swimsuits and swimming trunks. Everything happened so quickly that people did not have time to pick up either their documents or outer clothing. In the footage, you can hear that as the fire spreads, sounds reminiscent of gas cylinders exploding are heard.

According to the preliminary version of emergency services, it was the gas-air mixture that caused the rapid fire. At the moment, one victim is known - a man was hospitalized at a local hospital with a fracture. The administration of the Absheron region clarified that the number of victims may increase.

description: A survey by OpenMinds found that over 50% of Russians believe Ukraine's authorities were behind the terrorist attack at Crocus. The results also showed that 27% blamed ISIS, 6% blamed the 'collective West', and fewer respondents blamed Ukrainian war veterans and the Russian authorities.
original:
More than 50% of Russians believed in the official version of the authorities about Ukraine’s involvement in the terrorist attack at Crocus, - OpenMinds survey

The results of an online survey of the Anglo-Ukrainian OpenMinds project were published by the Financial Times. According to them, more than 50% of respondents believe that the terrorist attack was organized by the Ukrainian authorities, 27% believe that ISIS was behind the attack. Another 6% of respondents named the “collective West” as the organizers of the terrorist attack. Fewer respondents said the blame lay with Ukrainian war veterans and the Russian authorities. “A poll conducted shortly after the attack showed that most Russians believe Kiev is behind it, although with President Vladimir Putin suppressing dissent, “It is still difficult to determine how sincere the growth of anti-Ukrainian sentiments in Russia is,” the newspaper writes.

Moreover, among respondents aged 18-30 who oppose the war in Ukraine, 50% blame ISIS for the terrorist attack, while among supporters of the war the figure is 12%.

description: The second experimental Il-114-300 aircraft completed its first 40-minute flight, reaching altitudes of up to 900m and speeds of up to 230km/h. The new airliner features Russian components, improved flight characteristics, and enhanced ergonomics. It is designed to operate in challenging climatic conditions and replace An-24 aircraft on regional airlines.
original:
UAC has resumed flight testing of the new passenger Il-114-300. The second experimental aircraft of this type made its first flight, the Rostec state corporation, which includes UAC, reported. It lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes of up to 900 m and at speeds of up to 230 km/h.

Before taking to the skies, the aircraft completed a cycle of ground tests.

The new Il-144-300 consists entirely of Russian components. It is equipped with a TV7-117ST-01 engine, which has undergone a series of modifications.

The new airliner has improved flight characteristics, increased the use of composite materials, and improved almost all major systems. The designers paid special attention to improving the ergonomics of the cockpit, where a new digital flight navigation system was also installed.

The Il-114-300 is being created taking into account operation in difficult climatic conditions, as it is supposed to replace An-24 aircraft on regional airlines. Modern Russian-made regional aircraft are extremely necessary to solve the problems that the country's leadership has set for air transport. This is an increase in the mobility of our citizens, an increase in the intensity of air traffic in Russia by one and a half times by 2030,” noted the head of the Federal Air Transport Agency Dmitry Yadrov.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Pope Francis made a political statement during the Easter Mass, calling on world leaders to 'fight the scourge of inhumanity.' He urged for an immediate ceasefire in the Gaza Strip, the release of Israeli hostages, and an exchange of prisoners between Russia and Ukraine. He emphasized that peace is not achieved through weapons, but through open hearts and outstretched hands.
original:
At Sunday's Easter Mass, Pope Francis made political statements before the traditional "Urbi et Orbi" ("City and World") blessing and called on world leaders to "fight the scourge of inhumanity."

The pontiff called for an immediate ceasefire in the Gaza Strip and the creation of a corridor for humanitarian aid, as well as the release of Israeli hostages kidnapped by Hamas terrorists.

He spoke about the fate of children in war zones: “How much suffering we see in their eyes. Their views ask us: why are there so many deaths?

The Pope also called for an immediate exchange of prisoners between Russia and Ukraine, as well as an end to the war. “Peace is not created by weapons, but by outstretched hands and open hearts,” he said.

The head of the Catholic Church devoted 15 minutes of his speech to conflicts in different regions, mentioning Syria, Sudan and the Sahel zone, Armenia, Myanmar and the countries of the Western Balkans.

The incident occurred in Primorye - the would-be driver competed with his friend in oncoming races and in crossing a solid road. When police stopped the motorists, one of them silently handed the officers two $100 bills. And when he received a refusal, he immediately tried to gobble up the money, but the police managed to stop him. The court sentenced the hungry “racer” to four years probation, probation and a fine. event: Anniversary of Liberation of Kyiv Region
description: Two years ago, Ukrainian soldiers and civilians fought to expel Russian invaders from the Kyiv region, including Borodyanka, Bucha, Irpin, Gostomel, and Moschun. Today, Ukraine honors the strength and resilience of its people, who continue to fight for their country's freedom and independence.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
Two years have already passed since these days our soldiers, all our people expelled the Russian invaders from the Kyiv region. Borodyanka, Bucha, Irpin, Gostomel, Moschun were places of battles, places of struggle of Ukrainians for their country, for their lives, for their home, free from evil.

Today we honor the strength of each and every one who stood then, is now fighting, working and will definitely bring freedom to our entire land, to every town and village of Ukraine, which Russia wants to appropriate, but which it will have to give back - to the Ukrainians. Our people, our spirit, our strength will ensure it.

I thank everyone who helps! Thank you to everyone who is with Ukraine and in Ukraine! Thanks to our soldiers! I am proud of our people!
Glory to Ukraine!

description: The Rostov prosecutor's office has accused regional officials of neglecting the housing rights of citizens, despite a subsidy of 326 million rubles. The office has appealed to Governor Vasily Golubev three times in the past 10 days, urging him to influence his subordinates to address the issue.
original:
Forwarded from: ProCurator
What’s wrong with the Rostov prosecutor’s office? It has become common to hear that the prosecutor’s office is “atrocious.” Something is almost wrong - officials are losing their positions, or even being sent from their workplaces to places not so remote. But in Rostov something went wrong.

The prosecutor's office pointed out to the governor that officials were inattentive to the needs of residents of the Rostov region. From the governor of the Rostov region Vasily Golubev, prosecutors expect influence on his subordinates, since regional officials do not pay due attention to respecting the housing rights of citizens.

They say that despite the subsidy in the amount of 326 million rubles, the Ministry of Construction, Architecture and Territorial Development of the region was not ready for the timely redistribution of these funds to organize payments to citizens affected by the collapse of the house. Over the past 10 days, this is already the third appeal from the supervisory authority to Golubev. And not a single landing. Miracles, truly.

Earlier, the regional deputy prosecutor, Vladimir Khodursky, had already proposed a complete review of the regional emergency fund resettlement program. In his opinion, it did not include housing that was ready to collapse and, on the contrary, it included something that may not fall apart for some time due to its disrepair.

It is possible that the prosecutor’s office has laid out straws for itself in this way, and the first collapse will trigger the familiar “landing” mechanism.

description: On March 31, 1954, the USSR requested to join NATO, but was rejected by the United States, Great Britain, and France on May 7. The refusal was based on NATO's principles of individual freedom, democratic way of life, and open economic, military, and industrial positions. The USSR's membership would have allowed it to veto and paralyze NATO's work from within.
original:
“This is the same as if an inveterate robber asked to take him to work in the police”: we tell readers @Pravda_Gerashchenko how 70 years ago the USSR wanted to join NATO. On March 31, 1954, the USSR turned to NATO countries with a request to join the Alliance. On May 7, the United States, Great Britain and France rejected this proposal. The reasons for the refusal were formulated by the first Secretary General of the Alliance, Hastings Ismay, in his note: NATO countries must support individual freedom and a democratic way of life. must have an open economic, military and industrial position, allow allies to be subject to scrutiny.a the third point has become textbook: a Soviet request to join is like a hardened robber asking to be hired as a police officer. Blow up from within As the head of Soviet diplomacy, Vyacheslav Molotov, wrote in a draft note to the CPSU Central Committee, membership of the Soviet Union “would blow it up” [ Alliance] from the inside. After all, with the help of the veto, the USSR would simply paralyze all the work of NATO.

Molotov also saw advantages in refusal. According to him, by doing this, Western countries “will again expose themselves as organizers of a military bloc against other states, and this will strengthen the position of social forces fighting against the formation of the European Defense Community.” As time will tell, this did not intensify the fight against, but, on the contrary, consolidated the countries to form a common defensive community. Threat from the East, Prime Minister of Belgium and second Secretary General of NATO Paul-Henri Spaak noted that the USSR is the only country that emerged from the war with territorial acquisitions , imposed puppet governments in Central Europe, occupied Vienna and Berlin, and also prepared a springboard for further expansion in Europe.

According to the same Ismay, Moscow had a serious “edge” for attack in Western Europe. By mid-1954, the Kremlin had 6 million soldiers on standby. #interestingSubscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

It is needed to emphasize the legitimacy of the government, so that the people choose it, and so that no one has any doubts that this particular government was chosen by the people. And it is no coincidence that the West and Ukraine, in particular, tried so hard to disrupt, torpedo, and denigrate the election process in Russia. Because no one in Russia has any doubts that the elections showed how the people of Russia today see Russian power, and who they would like to see at the head of the country. description: A severe humanitarian crisis is unfolding in Rafah, Gaza Strip, where children are forced to eat grass, rats, or animal food due to extreme hunger and food scarcity. Malnutrition, dehydration, and disease are rampant, leading to a high number of child deaths. Many minors are left without adult care, and doctors in makeshift clinics struggle to diagnose and treat patients.
original:
“Hunger, want and suffering in Rafah. Children eat grass, rats or animal food" The German Tagesspiegel published a report on children in the Gaza Strip - illness, hunger and constant risk of death: Since December, the number of people suffering from hunger has more than doubled.

People, including children, eat grass, rats or animal food. There is very little food left in the south and it is extremely expensive. Children are already dying from malnutrition or dehydration.

At the same time, many of the minors were left without adults. You can often see children who are forced to take care of the same children.

In particular, 13,700 children were killed. And although bombs kill children, they are not the only threat: disease, dehydration and malnutrition also pose dangers. They also die from diarrhea and vomiting. We have no idea how many diseases are circulating here.

Doctors in makeshift tent clinics are unable to make a diagnosis, and the number of premature births is terribly high. Pregnant women are so stressed that they give birth too early and many babies end up in incubators.

And doctors have to decide: what to do if a newborn needs help? Should I send the more developed child home?

event: Chulpan Khamatova's Statement on Russians Abroad
description: Actress Chulpan Khamatova expressed her sadness about the situation of Russians living abroad, stating that they are not needed or wanted. She acknowledged the difficulties faced by Russians in exile, who may have to take on menial jobs to survive.
original:
Chulpan Khamatova about Russians abroad: Nobody needs us.

The actress said that she was sad to look at her colleagues who remained in the Russian Federation, and that she would have left Russia anyway.

However, she admitted that it is difficult for Russians in exile.

“I understood so much that no one was waiting for us here, no one needed us. And if you want your children to have a piece of bread and some clothes, then you will work as a taxi driver, courier, whatever, give private acting lessons...”

Tactical nuclear charge, approximately 1.5-2 kilotons. But without the primary factors of a nuclear explosion. It itself completely destroys all fortified areas.

“But if they make this thing and find a carrier, and this is a Tu-22, then such a thing will play more on the moral and psychological state of the personnel.

One and a half tons like***. If it hits someone, the person immediately decomposes into molecules. A kilometer or three away, the eardrums burst. And fear, panic. description: The Port of Baltimore, the largest US port, remains locked down due to sabotage, causing significant economic losses of up to $200 million per day. The only floating crane capable of lifting fallen metal structures is out of commission, leaving cargo idle in warehouses and ships waiting to be unloaded. The blockade also affects US Army cargo units, preventing the transportation of military cargo to Europe, including Ukraine.
original:
Sabotage of the Year
The harbor of the largest US port of Baltimore is still not unlocked, as the Americans cannot pull up the only floating crane in the country that is capable of lifting metal structures that have fallen into the water. At the same time, the US economy is suffering serious losses: according to various sources, up to $
Show more
200 million per day: since cargo is idle in the port’s warehouses, ships are also piling up in the Baltimore roadstead, waiting to be unloaded. Plus, cargo floating units of the US Army were blocked at the berths, which could not transport military cargo to Europe, including Ukraine.
The Port of Baltimore, the largest supplier of imports and exports of cars and light trucks to the United States, looks set to be out of service indefinitely.

Many children walk around the city restlessly, lacking security and care. They are literally trapped here. The number of people suffering from hunger has more than doubled since December. Many of the minors were left without adults. You can often see children who are forced to take care of the same children. 13,700 children are listed as dead. @radiomirby

description: The second experimental Il-114-300 aircraft completed its first 40-minute flight, reaching altitudes of 900m and speeds of 230km/h. The crew tested the aircraft's stability, controllability, and Russian-made systems and equipment, reporting a smooth flight with all systems functioning properly.
original:
The second experimental aircraft Il-114-300 during the first flight from the airfield of the branch of PJSC "UAC" - LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin - piloted by a crew consisting of the aircraft commander, chief pilot, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Sergei Sukhar, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Igor Zinov, on-board test engineer 1st class Oleg Gryazev. The flight lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes up to 900 m and at speeds up to 230 km/h.

During the tests, the stability and controllability of the aircraft was checked, as well as the stable operation of Russian systems and equipment, most of which were manufactured by enterprises of the Rostec State Corporation.

The crew commander reported that the flight went smoothly, the systems and equipment worked properly, and the flight program was completed in full. Before the start of flights, the aircraft underwent a cycle of ground tests: workshop and airfield tests were carried out. Also, as part of the flight test program, taxiing and high-speed runs were performed. TelegramV Z - VZGLYAD.RUOAC resumed the flight test program of the Il-114-300, within the framework of which the second prototype aircraft made its first flight from the airfield of the branch of PJSC UAC - LAZ named after. P.A. Voronina.VIEW MESSAGE

description: Russian servicemen launched a massive shelling of the village of Borova in Izyum district, killing a 19-year-old boy and injuring a 27-year-old man. The attack damaged residential buildings, shops, and other infrastructure. Preliminary data suggests the use of the Uragan anti-aircraft missile system.
location: Borova, Izyum Raion, Kharkiv Oblast, Ukraine
original:
🔷The occupiers shelled the Izyum Oblast: one person died, another was injured🖌️ Under the procedural leadership of the Izyum District Prosecutor's Office of the Kharkiv Region, a pre-trial investigation was launched into the fact of violation of the laws and customs of war, combined with intentional murder (Part 2 of Article 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

According to the investigation, on March 31, around 00:35, Russian servicemen launched a massive shelling of the village of Borova, Izyum district. A 19-year-old boy died. A 27-year-old man received a shrapnel wound. He was hospitalized in serious condition.

High-rise and private residential buildings, shops, etc., were damaged in the settlement.

According to preliminary data, the enemy struck the city with the Uragan anti-aircraft missile system.

Prosecutors and police investigators take all possible and appropriate measures to document war crimes committed by representatives of the armed forces of the Russian Federation. ⚔ Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

description: A new three-story kindergarten for 110 children was opened on Bryantseva Street after overcoming construction delays and contractor issues. The city has built over 200 schools and kindergartens in the past four and a half years and aims to eliminate the accumulated deficit by building 90 more this year.
location: Bryantseva Street, Murmansk, Murmansk Oblast, Russia
original:
A new three-story building of kindergarten No. 54 for 110 children was opened on Bryantseva Street.
Residents of the area have been waiting for several years for the kindergarten to open. But there were problems with the contractor at the site: he stopped work and missed deadlines. We changed the contractor - we had to go to court, and at an accelerated pace in
Show more
existing buildings, which is quite difficult, the kindergarten was completed.
Over the past four and a half years, we have built more than 200 schools and kindergartens. This year we will work hard and practically eliminate the accumulated deficit - we will build 90 kindergartens and schools. And from 2025 we will begin planned construction of such facilities.
We try to equip kindergartens with glass domes over the premises so that the kids have more sun, we install swimming pools and salt caves in all kindergartens and schools - we are a northern city, and it is important that children grow up healthy.

description: Hippotherapy is being used to rehabilitate wounded soldiers, including those who have lost limbs. The Nalmes Equestrian Center, with instructors Olga and Anna, is providing this therapy to help soldiers cope with their injuries and improve their physical and mental well-being.
original:
How a horse can change your outlook on the world and on lifeRehabilitation of wounded soldiers, especially those who have lost limbs, is important for our society, especially now when hostilities continue.

Our old comrade, a soldier of the 1st AK with the call sign "Abdulla", who lost both legs back in 2017, showed us what helps him cope with a serious injury, prepare for prosthetics, normalize blood pressure and sugar in the blood, and just always stay on horseback.

There's really no secret. The gelding “Aldan” helps Abdulla treat his soul and body, together with Olga and Anna, hippotherapy instructors at the Nalmes Equestrian Center.

We went to visit the center's employees, met the instructors and their students, and saw for ourselves how stern and seriously wounded military men get into the saddle and forget about their worries for a while. Read more in our new story this evening.

wargonzo

description: Experts reveal that the NATO Treaty's defense clause does not apply to Hawaii, as the document only mentions defending territories in Europe and North America. This exclusion is despite Hawaii being a US state and hosting the largest base of the US Pacific Fleet, Pearl Harbor.
original:
The defense clause of the NATO Treaty does not apply to Hawaii. CNN reports, citing experts, that the document mentions the possibility of defending territories “in Europe and North America,” while the state is located in the Pacific Ocean.

Hawaii became a US state 10 years after NATO was signed in 1959. “The argument for not including Hawaii is simply that it is not part of North America,” said an expert at a Hawaii think tank. David Santoro. The absurdity of the situation also lies in the fact that the largest base of the US Pacific Fleet, Pearl Harbor, is located in the state. It was here that Japanese troops attacked during World War II, which became the reason for the United States to enter the conflict. Subscribe to “Paragraph”
